intro: Boronia tetrathecoides, commonly known as the four-ovary boronia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal regions, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
